Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to comply with removal order under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the enforcement officer erred in denying deferral of removal
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant requested deferral due to ongoing PRRA judicial review and claimed exigent personal circumstances; officer found no new risks beyond previously adjudicated issues
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Deferral of removal pending judicial review
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Judicial review allowed; matter referred to a different officer for redetermination
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Enforcement officer assessed risk and judicial review likelihood unreasonably
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Exigent personal circumstances and pending litigation
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Removal must occur as soon as reasonably practicable unless valid reasons exist for deferral
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Timeline for judicial review and likelihood of success
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Judicial review does not automatically stay removal
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Officer did not find new credible risks
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Prior risk assessments, details of pending judicial review
Crimes.Application_Basis: Request for deferral based on ongoing legal proceedings and personal circumstances
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Existence and timeline of judicial review, personal risk claims
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Stay of removal until resolution of judicial review
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Removal orders enforced promptly absent compelling reasons
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Officer underestimated judicial review timeline and improperly assessed merits
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Potential harm upon removal not sufficiently new or demonstrated
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant sought deferral due to ongoing PRRA judicial review and claimed exigent personal circumstances
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Officer failed to properly assess timing and viability of judicial review
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Insufficient new evidence presented, but procedural misstep in assessment
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Non-compliant due to failure to depart after removal order
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Officer incorrectly assumed judicial review could be completed pre-removal
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Decision deemed unreasonable due to flawed assumptions about legal process
Crimes.Decision_Making_Body: Enforcement Officer, later reviewed by Federal Court
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Misjudgment of judicial review timeline and merit

Crimes.Violation_Type: Remaining in Canada beyond authorized period
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the enforcement officer erred in denying deferral of removal
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant overstayed visa and sought deferral due to ongoing litigation and claimed risks upon return
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Deferral of removal pending judicial review
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Judicial review allowed; case referred for redetermination by different officer
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Officer assumed judicial review could be completed before removal, which was unreasonable
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Risk to life and pending judicial review
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Removal must occur as soon as reasonably practicable unless compelling personal circumstances exist
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Timeline of judicial review and credibility of risk claims
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Judicial review does not automatically trigger stay of removal
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Officer found insufficient new evidence of risk
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Claims of risk upon return, status of judicial review application
Crimes.Application_Basis: Request for deferral based on litigation and safety concerns
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Nature and urgency of judicial review, personal risk documentation
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Stay of removal until judicial review is resolved
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Removal should proceed unless there are compelling reasons to defer
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of new evidence; incorrect assumption about review timeline
Crimes.Outcome: Officerâ€™s decision set aside; remitted for redetermination
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Alleged risk to life if removed, though not newly substantiated
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant overstayed her visa and sought deferral of removal due to ongoing litigation and claimed risks upon return
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Officer failed to reasonably assess the practical timeline of legal proceedings
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: IRPA provisions on unauthorized stay and removal
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Insufficient new evidence, but procedural error in evaluation
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Officer unreasonably minimized the time required for judicial review
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Decision was unreasonable due to flawed factual assumptions
Crimes.Decision_Making_Body: Enforcement Officer, later reviewed by Federal Court
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Misassessment of judicial review duration and relevance
